thread.title: Anthony Martial, Leicester and ‘bottlers’ Tottenham: Nine things we learnt this Premier League weekend
thread.title_full: Anthony Martial, Leicester and ‘bottlers’ Tottenham: Nine things we learnt this Premier League weekend

author: jgordon
title: Anthony Martial, Leicester and ‘bottlers’ Tottenham: Nine things we learnt this Premier League weekend
text:
Keep up to date with ALL the Premier League news, gossip, transfers and goals plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And Manchester United briefly moved up to fifth and will hope to mount a top-four charge after Anthony Martian returned with a bang. 
Here are nine things we learnt from another action-packed weekend in the Premier League. Related Stories FOR FOX SAKE No goals in TEN games and the worst team in England this year... the damning stats behind Leicester's demise PREMIER TABLE Leaders Chelsea drop points, Arsenal climb to third and Man Utd close gap on City PEP TALK Pep Guardiola says Jack Wilshere can be one of Prem's best midfielders if he recreates 2011 form BLUE IT Antonio Conte despairs after Chelsea drop points at Burnley and says SIX teams are in the hunt for the title ALAN SHEARER Liverpool may be finally celebrating a Premier League win in 2017, but in reality their season is over SIEGE OF TROY Premier League ace Troy Deeney threatened with pepper spray by cops outside club - after being punched by fans wanting a photo Burn victims Burnley 1-1 Chelsea : Robbie Brady nets stunning free kick after Pedro opener 
Conte knew he was facing a tricky contest as he took his leaders to Burnley following their demolition of Arsenal. 
And despite Pedro bagging the opener, a super Robbie Brady free-kick pegged the Blues back and the sides shared the spoils. 
The Clarets have the fourth best home record in the league after picking up an astonishing 30 of their 31 points at Turf Moor. Champions to Championship? Swansea 2-0 Leicester : Mawson and Olsson both score to leave Leicester in trouble 
Claudio Ranieri was given the dreaded vote of confidence last week - but his players do not appear to share the owners' enthusiasm. 
The Foxes have now gone TEN HOURS of football without a goal and Jamie Vardy has fired a blank in 23 of his last 24 club games. 
That dismal run combined with Robert Huth and Wes Morgan finally showing their age after last season's heroics is a recipe for disaster. Friends re-United Manchester United 2-0 Watford : United move one point behind City in fourth 
Anthony Martial responded to Jose Mourinho's criticism by playing a role in both goals as Manchester United downed Watford. 
The Frenchman teed-up Juan Mata to sweep home the opener before drilling in a second for a deserved strike of his own. 
There had been much speculation that Mourinho had given up on the Frenchman but more performances like this and he will be going nowhere this summer. Reds earn their Spurs Liverpool 2-0 Tottenham : Liverpool win for the first time this year 
Liverpool ended a dire run in 2017 with a comfortable victory over top-four rivals Tottenham. 
Jurgen Klopp's side had Sadio Mane's return to thank for their revival as the Senegal star bagged a brace. 
The Reds look a different side with his pace up top but may rue a run which saw their title hopes and two cup runs snapped. Lilywhites Tottering again
